text:
You know I love trying new things around town (well, near me anyway). I came here today with my best friend and I wasn't quite sure what to expect. I expected good food because of the reviews i read but to be honest I still wasn't sure what to expect.

I ordered the braised chicken with vegetables and rice and it was AMAZING!! my friend ordered a panini with cranberry sauce and caramalized onions and it was INSANELY GOOD!!! I couldn't believe it.

the atmosphere was so lovely too. It was so comfortable there: they had couches, tables, a breakfast bar table like thing, benches with tables. Oh it was adorable and I loved it there. what could be more great besides the lunch items and the Nutella cremé bruleé. one of the best deserts i have ever had....

Every 10-15 minutes one of the employees came out and wiped down the empty tables and picked up the up the dirty plates and cups from their spot to get washed and squeaky clean.

if you plan to go to a bakery try this one first. It will knock your socks off.

We selected C&S to cater the pies for our wedding. The little bakery was very cute, and the pies were very good, so it was a very easy decision for us. We emailed Chef Megan and she responded within a week. I later tried to contact her; however, she would take so long to respond, I had to ask if she was even still interested in catering our wedding. Once she responded, she mentioned that we should meet up to further discuss. Since we do not live in Las Vegas, we had to plan a special trip to meet her. Chef Megan was nice enough, but she was extremely scatterbrained! After we perfected our order and paid a deposit, we wanted to try some pies. They only had mini berry pies available, so we said that we would love to try one. That was no problem, and then she proceeded to ring us up...for the $4 pie. I was a little taken back that we were buying $600 in pie, and she charged us to taste a mini $4 pie!? One the day of the wedding, I received an email saying that the pies had been delivered; however, they forgot something in the order, so could I please pick it up. Of course I can't pick it up - I'm getting married, and I've already paid you $80 to deliver everything!! By the way, the $80 delivery is literally just that - they do not set anything up; rather, they just hand the pies off to the venue. 

The pies were pretty good; some were better than the others. I think that this little business could really be amazing if Chef Megan stayed in the kitchen and hired someone to run the place. C&S needs someone less scatterbrained that knows how to deal with the public.

The pastries are great! However, I really wish there was a designated cashier and barista. The girl behind the counter was really friendly and I felt bad for her because she not only had to take orders but make coffee as well. It's not her fault our coffee took a while to come out, but the fault of poor management.
Amazing little cafe on the west side. Love to come here with friends. Also, as a jersey boy, makes me proud to come to a jersey owner cafe. Thank you!!!
Stopped  by with my wife for qucik bit..will be coming back for sure the oreo musse was delicious and the tea even better awsome place for a quick bit
Robin was super pleasant and helpful. I had a iced hazelnut latte which was delish! Ceasar salad eith croissant so yummie!!!!

Service: As soon as we walked in we were not greeted and gave a very mean look from the counter girl. As we were looking for what we wanted to order, she rudely scolded us about how they're closing when it was literally an hour before they were supposed to. As we asked for more time she walked away and gave this really disgusting "tsssssk" sound. Basically she told us to settle with what's made and not to order more because "they're closing." Afterwards, when asking what's good she was no help whatsoever and gave more attitude as if she was so eager to get out of work already! As she was packing our treats she was having an obnoxiously loud conversation with her coworker and swearing left and right. She was touching our food with her bare hands right after she was done texting on her phone on shift: unprofessional to say the least! And who knows where her phones been? Anyways, her coworker was nice enough to start a conversation with us and being generally friendly aside from the front counter girl's nasty attitude. Service wise, from this girl alone, was absolutely terrible! If this is the standards of customer service in this establishment then the management ought to be ashamed. The pastries were great nonetheless, but this one worker was absolutely ridiculous.

Cannoli: very tasty! Not too overpowering in sweetness and perfect in balance. A bit stale however.

Nutella chocolate bar: so so chocolatey! And a good kind of rich and creamy consistency when you bite into it. Just one is enough chocolate to satisfy cravings.

Espresso chocolate cup: favorite by far! Perfect balance and the espresso cream inside is to die for. The only thing I didn't like as much was the chocolate cup itself. The design was adorable but the chocolate used was a little bland. 

Caramel tarte: the texture of the caramel was strange although it definitely was good.

TLDR; I came here with my BF because we've been dying to try the desserts here; they looked amazing from the other photos on Yelp! But service here was one of the most terrible experiences I've had so far. The counter girl was outright obnoxious, rude and unsanitary. But the four pastries we took a shot at were pretty delicious and a nice surprise. Will not be returning unless service experience is taken care of, despite exceptional treats.

Loved this cafe! As soon as i walked in I was greeted with a smile and and friendly hello!  Sat down and had a wonderful breakfast. I ordered the chorizo omlette, it was made perfectly and extremely tasty!!! Also had the neutella latte, and that was heavenly!! Tasted some pastries and honestly every one I had was great!!! From the lemon bars, to the chocolate bomb  cake, was absolutely outstanding!!! A must try and worth the ride if your not in the area!!!

I've been in twice and it's so cute inside and the bakery/chocolate counter is a dangerous delicious place. Their turkey sandwich and salad were good, although the lemon vinaigrette was oddly not lemony, but tasted mostly of olive oil. The pumpkin chocolate cake I had was in a league of its own and I'm a chocolate cake snob. It was moist, had the perfect balance of cake and frosting, the frosting was light and chocolatey and I detected maybe a little cream cheese or maybe it was buttermilk, whatever it was it added a depth of flavor. And the pumpkin was a brilliant compliment. The second time I went, I had the egg white frittata with pesto, a blueberry scone, and Mexican hot chocolate. The pesto was so fresh I wanted to take a bottle home or definitely try there pasta another day. The frittata was eggcelent! So fluffy and tasty, I never missed the yokes. The hot chocolate was too sweet, but would be amazing with that one correction. And of course...the scone...crunchy ouside, soft inside, buttery, lightly sweet, magical. Any way...go...run to this place with your nearest friend and have a great meal in this cozy cafe.

What is Joseph A. talking about? First of all if you are going to rate a bakery, do your homework. The owner is Megan Romano, a woman! She is highly skilled, trained, and uses the finest quality ingredients and she is a local business owner who braved the Las Vegas recession to follow her passion. Second, just go get your average, machine made croissant at Starbuck's where you will pay the same amount and keep your negative comments to yourself. I guess yelp is like a person, there is always one ass*&%e!
Anyway...Went there on a Sunday morning to dive into all of her offerings. WOW! We met Megan herself and she was so gracious, helpful and friendly. We ordered the banana cream pie, very fresh and creamy for sure. We also had the ham and Gruyere fritatta, nice savory start to our spiral into sugarland. We enjoyed the chocolate and hazelnut tarte, super velvety chocolate with a hazelnut crust and gooey caramel. Then we had the espresso chip shortbread cookie with a caramel and chocolate filling....ummmm WOW. Nice balance of salty sweet flavors and smooth, crunchy textures. Nice to dip into my espresso. Then...it gets even better because Megan brought us out a almond cake with warm fig compote and marscapone cream topped with fresh peaches-this is a must! We finished with three gelatos (house made of course) the grapefruit, my favorite, strawberry watermelon, and cantaloupe.

Looking at the inventory of what we indulged in now has me heading to the gym. It was worth the sweat and hard work to enjoy all the beautiful and delicious creations Megan Romano has prepared for our town. Embrace her genius!

Charming bakery and coffee shop,,, with a relaxing atmosphere and delectable desserts! Went to celebrate a birthday and tried several sweets: banana creme pie, strawberry rhubarb pie, peanut butter bar and triple choco mousse. We shared bites and all were delicious. The banana creme pie definitely has a unexpected twist and was not your typical pie. The crust is similar to a Napoleon... light, flaky and crispy and the insides are a creamy "bnanna" melt in your mouth custard, topped with ample whip creme, a caramel drizzle and choc shaving.The peanut butter bar and mousse were rich and chocolaty. The strawberry pie a traditional treat with fabulous crust. The staff was welcoming and friendly and more then willing to explain in detail choices. We came at 6:30pm and asked if they close promptly at 7pm, to make our decision to stay or go and the counter staff indicated they would stay as long as we needed. Can't ask for more then that!

I was excited to try this place today for the first time. A friend and I ate in the establishment. I was extremely disappointed that my order for a sandwich was incorrectly done and I got a wrap instead. Also, my iced mocha was forgotten completely. I thought the girl at the front counter was just slow, but after 15 min,  I walked up and she said she just forgot. There weren't even a lot of people in the bakery when I ordered (just me and a friend and 2 other people). When the iced mocha was finally brought to the table, it was just an iced coffee. I took it up to the front and she said they don't make iced mocha and that she thought I meant that I wanted an iced coffee when I clearly asked for an iced mocha. Umm, okay. Lastly, I asked for a copy of my receipt because one was not given to me when I payed. She couldn't locate the copy and told me that she'd bring it to my table with my drink. Of course she didn't, and I didn't press it later because I was already frustrated with her forgetfulness. I didn't even want to waste my time getting a dessert before leaving. I will never go to this place again and will not recommend it to anyone either. It's a shame because I was really looking for a nice local coffee place to frequent. Oh well, the search continues...
Fresh food good portions especially that Burger! Ladies get your husband this burger and he will shut up.

Who am I kidding, I ordered a small salad and peach iced tea while I stared at the bakery case of Chocolate and Spice. I caved in and ordered about 9 of these scrumptious looking desserts to go. One for me and the others for my veterinarian's office. I ate the banana cream pie in my car enroute to my vet. I am sure I had pie all over my face and I was sad when a few crumbs ended up on my passenger seat. Come for the desserts and justify it with a bike spin class in the afternoon.

Rolling in Dough apparently bought out Leopold's Bakery in Las Vegas...I ordered a cake through Leopold's still active website that comes up as "Leopolds Bakery Rolling in Dough - Las Vegas and directs you to http://www.leopoldsbakery.com. After I placed the order I received an email confirmation and confirmation number. Went in the following day to pick it up at the address on the website only to find out that the bakery is now owned by Rolling in Dough. And there was no cake ready.

The girl at the counter was apologetic and explained that Rolling in Dough was the new name. She was extremely helpful in producing a cake with the appropriate Happy Birthday and name on it...thanks to her and the Chef for making it happen. But this should never have come to this. I asked for the owner to call me to let them know what the issue was but have not heard from them. Based on reading some other reviews there appears to be some fundamental business practices that need attention. So...beware anyone that orders a cake from this company unless maybe you go in person. I just checked the website 5 days later and the site is still active and accepting orders...

This cafe has sandwiches, coffee, ice cream, pastries and desserts. The pastry I got today was extremely stale though. This place is also unorganized. We came in from one door and a family came in through the 2nd door @ the same time and no one acknowledged us at all although we were the only customers there. It seemed like everyone was busy (at least 3 employees) doing the same thing. We were just standing there for a while when 3 other customers came in at different times. A lady walked back and forth by the register and she finally looked annoyed and left. A gentleman was looking over the pastries trying to get someone's attention and everyone still had their backs turned away so he also left. We waited patiently until a sweet girl helped the family and a 2nd equally sweet girl helped us as well almost at the same time. I think this cute cafe is doing okay but if it was more organized and they had some kind of timer for the pastries & other goods to notify them when its time to throw them out, this place would really be an excellent $ maker for the owner. When you walk into a Starbucks everyone has a different duty & that's part of the reason I keep going back. There's always someone at the register, someone making the coffee, and someone else handling a different duty whether its getting the pastries or drive thru. Team work people. But I will continue going to this cafe as well only if I'm in the area to get the croissant BLT and possibly a pastry. I'll just make sure to ask for a fresh batch next time.
This is a cool place to hang out. Great banana cream pie. Fun to sit around and people watch. If youre in this area you should definitely drop by.

Wow! Ate here for the first time and love this place. I love that quality local eateries are starting to pop up in the Vegas neighborhoods. Their pastries and sweets are outstanding but may even be topped by their home cooking. I had the braised chicken with cous cous for lunch and it was outstanding. Great flavors and the love of cooking are in this dish.

Support local artisans everyone.

Choc. & Spice is a wonderful bakery, where everything tastes as good as it looks.  The atmosphere is inviting, the staff friendly and the service excellent.  The Vegas crowd is fortunate that Megan Romano stayed in town after her stint at Aureole.  

Everything is made with quality ingredients, from the breakfast pastries to the fine quality chocolates. Special Kudos to the bakery's sous chef, Keris, for getting up early and making the best  homemade donuts (with chocolate ganache) for my daughter's birthday.  She wanted donuts....  I don't even like donuts and these were amazing.  Unlike most donuts these were not too sweet.

No more running down to Bouchon or Payard every time we want a tasty treat, and in many instances Choc. & Spice is better. 

BTW:  First time posting on Yelp. I have never been compelled to post before.
Comfy atmosphere...mini fruit pies are amazing. Great to have non-corporate options in Vegas.

Cute place! But a little disorganized in display and service. I would have liked it to be more of a coffee shop so I can get my extreme coffee drink. Also, I got sick after eating the food!!!!!:/ yikes!

Found this place here on yelp...Ordered a red velvet cake for my husbands birthday .... The cake was awesome and moist ! But the frosting was horrible it was supposed to be cream cheese frosting but it tasted like sweetened butter.  We won't be going back there.

I work in this office complex - and this is a great place to have a casual business meeting or to hangout with a friend. It has a great feel and is a great alternative to your run of the mill, cheaper by the dozen coffee shop.

I have never written a Yelp review but thought this was a MUST!  I live in San Francisco and was busy and almost forgot my father's birthday.  Knowing my fathers love of sweets.  I went on a mission to find him a cake that could be delivered. I stumbled upon great reviews of this place and decided to go out on a limb and call. Not only did Megan (the owner) agree to make something great for him but she personally delivered it to my father's home that day.  The cake was beautiful and my father and his friends said incredibly delicious.  SHe went above and beyond and I am so grateful.  It was such a great hit and to see that Megan and her bakery are one of the best in Vegas I felt incredibly fortunate. Thank you Megan for making my dad feel special.  In my next visit to Vegas I will make sure to make it in to try some of your fabulous creations.
Great little find. I had a fruit bowl & tea while my daughter took a cupcake cooking class. This is much more than a bakery - great lunch menu with sandwiches & salads.

Great spot for breakfast, lunch or dessert & coffee. Everything is handcrafted at reasonable prices. Waffles, eggs, fresh fruit, salads, sandwiches, soups and decadent desserts. Waitstaff is friendly and accommodating. Like to stop by when  I'm in the neighborhood.

Their sandwiches and pastries are sooooooo good. Especially the chicken salad croissants and Nutella Bomb are my favorites!!!and I want to appreciate that it opens at 7am every morning which provides me a perfect healthy breakfast before school or work!  LUV it~

This place is so cute that I desperately wanted to love it! I first came when they had just opened. Came in every day for lunch, looking for that one thing that was going to wow me and keep me coming back for more. I did like their chocolate croissants... but then everything else just fell flat. Noticeably flat was the Mexican Hot Chocolate.... didn't even taste like it had chocolate.

Today, I came back after over a year of not visiting. I thought that maybe it had improved since then. Not so. 

My intention was to buy the chocolate, but went during lunch time so I decided to have lunch as well. They have a sign that says the lunch specials, and it talked about a salmon sandwich. I decided to go with that. Turns out there's no salmon. 

Let me think about this for a second: your lunch special is a salmon sandwich, it's 12:15 pm, there's people here but it's not exactly packed (there's not even a line)... but you have no salmon. 

Ok, I go for the half soup half wrap lunch combo. I go for the tomato soup and chicken salad wrap. I also get my chocolate, there's only seven flavors to choose from, so I take one of each. I paid $29 for a half wrap, half soup, a cappuccino, and what turns out to be six pieces of chocolate (after repeatedly telling the attendant I wanted one of each, she still left one out). 

I get my food and get to business. The soup is lukewarm! Before I could even make it halfway it was straight cold. Ok, the cappuccino is not very hot either. The chocolate was given to me in a crappy paper bag, despite the fact that they have chocolate boxes on display. They also seem to be sloppily made. The chicken salad wrap was good but nothing to write home about. 

And then I remembered, I never really liked this place and I probably never will. It's too bad because with a famous name attached to it, and all the work and money they seem to have put towards it, you'd think they would they would put the same amount of effort towards the food. It is what they are selling after all.
Was recommended this bakery from my venue for my wedding. They provided our marble wedding cake and Boston creme cake grooms cake. They were both amazing!! Recommending this bakery!

We ordered 4 dishes: quiche, chicken sandwich, French toast, and breakfast burger special. Everything was amazing but the only thing I felt was the French toast was a little pricy for its portion. I guess we were expecting a bigger portion from the other Yelp pictures but damn it was a small size for that price. Other than that it was a great place to get that chicken sandwich. It was so bomb. Literally melted in my mouth !!

Ugh are you kidding me?  I had read some great things about this place in the past but boy was it awful! Does Megan Romano still own this, because she must not be hanging around here, I expected so much more!  Arrived after 2 p.m. assuming there would be a rush.  There were 2 people in the whole place.  Set up was very confusing about... do you sit down?  Do you order at the counter?  Looking into the pastry case (somethings were labeled with tiny labels, others had no label and we had to guess) there were sandwiches displayed that were obviously days old, with the edges of the cheese and the eggs all dark colored and curled up, really disgusting and totally unappetizing.  The girl behind the counter (who later I discovered was in a rush to leave for the day) was not helpful and kept asking 'is that all you want', 'is that all you want'.  We assumed that what was in the case was all there was.  I am short (5'1" tall) and I didnt even see those chalk board menus way over on the other side of the kitchen, until after I had already ordered!  There were no printed menus, and nothing close enough for a customer to see, take a look at and maybe take a minute to decide.  When I asked what kind of salads they had she said 'we only have the house salad for $7.25'. $30 for two croissant sandwiches, two teas and a 'house salad', WOW in a place with no customer service tableside.   The high point of my lunch was that the croissant roll itself was fantastic, great job!  Otherwise, my ham and gruyere was just that..several slices of ham and a slice of cheese.  No condiments, no lettuce, tomato. (I was craving some great boutique kind of mustard or maybe that apricot aioli that was stated to be on the turkey sandwich).  My partner had a BLT.  Two strips of bacon in a $7 sandwich, really guys?  The salad would win the award for worst combination of a ton of ingredients in a salad.  The lettuce used was romaine, and it was the pale inner, sour leaves of the romaine, sliced up but some werent even sliced up, I had to wrestle some of it with my plastic fork.  The dressing was so sweet it was like pouring simple syrup on the salad, which already had figs, cranberries, candied hazelnuts, and what I think was pear poached in vanilla syrup (overkill).  It was like eating dessert, except I forgot to mention there were tiny slivers of what I think were salami - like that ingredient seemed so random among the rest of them.  It took me 20 minutes to get that sugar taste out of my mouth.  Tables were dirty, the floor looked like it had not been mopped in days or a week, the front windows were dirty inside and out.  The cabinet that was doubling as the trash receptacle and at the same time held your forks and condiments  (ewww that they are right next to each other) was an area that was dirty, confusing, and I really objected to using a plastic fork taken from a plastic cup full of forks, in a place charging this kind of money.  No napkins.  The interior was fun and hip, but between the decor design and ALL the stuff in the two pastry cases, and then the 4 different chalk board menus, piles of cookies, popcorn and candy in packaging, I really felt like this place was having an identity crisis or trying to be too many things to people.  Would you go into a place and order a 'Kalbi Beef Rib' dish at the same place where you can get an egg white frittata?  Just a really confusing all over the place menu.  And to call it a bakery and 90% of their items are cakes and chocolates and no bread or rolls in sight, is a bit of a stretch as far as identity as well.  It should be a cafe that sells baked goods.  Not a bakery selling involved food like ribs.  I definitely would not return.

It was my first time here, and I love the decor of this bakery/cafe. They had beautifully designed cakes and pastries in the window. I stopped in for a quick bite and ordered the Egg White Frittata. It cane with arugula, cherry tomato, scallion, parmesian, and pesto. At first I was a little disappointed that they didn't make it fresh to order. But then after my first bite I was pleased how tasty and moist it was, and the portion was larger than I expected. My overall experience was great and I would stop in again only if I was in that side of town.
The banana cream pie is so good,  whole eating it, you will find yourself moaning with pleasure.  Love this place and come here when I want a gourmet sweet treat.

Came into shop today with the intentions of getting just a cup of coffee but ended up getting a incredible coconut cake for my daughter and pumkin bunt cake which were suggested by Lola the nice lady attending me. I think with every great bakery comes great employees who go above and beyond with great customer service .  I will definitely be back for more great pastries but also because Lola is a gem of a employee who can turn someone's day around for the better with a simple hello. A great cup of coffee in a cozy atmosphere along with excellent customer service by Lola is why I give this place 5 stars.

I love this bakery and lunch spot.  It is decorated so cute and the food is really good!  I love the egg white frittata and the butternut squash soup!  You may have to wait a little while for your food as they don't have a lot of people working behind the counter but it is worth the wait:)

I visited Chocolate & Spice for the first time last week. I sort of had a fight with myself about going there because one part of me wanted to try something new while the other wanted to go back to my favoride German bakery. I ended up going anyway. There was so much to look at and all of it looked great.  
But the only thing that worried me was how much everything costs. 
That day I didn't have a lot to spend but some of the prices of some items put me off. 
But hey, the owner can price his pastries anyway he wants.

I bought just one of the little Banana Cream Pies for $3.75 as a gift for my mom.
It's a nice bakery with good looking pastries but after I left I went straight back to my German bakery and got much more bang for my little buck.

Robin was very helpful and had the best sunny disposition. The food was great. Best vanilla latte I've had in a long time. It was on the sweeter side so I opted for a raspberry slice of cake which had a great lemon undertone and was super moist. Frosting was not too sweet and very creamy. The berry salad was very light and perfect for a warm day. I will definitely be returning.
Found them on yelp and glad we did!!! Definitelya great place to sit and have a full breakfast or quick coffee! Cute atmosphere also!!
I would definitely recommend for anyone with a sweet tooth and for regular breakfast or lunch. Simple menu and great decor.

I tried. I really did. But the bakeries have pulled me back into their delicious fattening goodness!

Dang.

So...have been meaning to stop into this bakery for a while, and when I realized I was passing by a place with the word "chocolate" in the name, you can bet I made a quick turn and headed in to find something sweet. NY Resolution...over. 

The signage caught my eye as this is now Rolling the Dough Bakery and Chocolate and Spice. I was intrigued as I entered I noticed that the sitting area was cute and there were lots of goodies in the case.

I have to say that my experience with the staff was great and the mini chocolate cake that the sales associate suggested was DELISH! I wanted to get more but if I did, I would eat it. So.

Now. This not my style at all...but I have to say something. They say, if you see something, say something, right?

I have to commend the staff the most for the professional service they provided to the incredibly rude woman in line ahead of me. I will not recount how she behaved, as you can read it in her Yelp review that she posted recently. Her nasty words and tone match exactly as you would think she would be in real life.  I have never in my life encountered someone so entitled and belligerent and I honestly watched in awe as the patient staff members accommodated her every ignorant demand. 

I try not to meddle, but when I saw the review she posted on Yelp, I had to be sure that someone represented what actually happened. The staff here can be proud of how professionally they responded to the classless display of raving lunacy by the "lady" in front of me. Congratulations on a job well done. The cake was superb and the service was 5 star. I should deduct one star for making me ruin my diet, but that was bound to happen.

I had breakfast AND lunch here! Great little place - great food and friendly service! ...and their selection of pastries made fresh are Fabulous - you will want to try them all! I had the canolis and the fruit tart!! To find this location you have to turn into the strip mall and then turn left.

To be honest with you on my first experience wasn't bad. I have a big time sweet tooth and love packing on the pounds during the winter. This place did its job. I saw that the other reviews were hit and miss but decided to try it anyways. How to give them 5 stars because the experience that I had was great and the chocolate was awesome unfortunately going to have to go back to the gym so I can keep up my sugar binge

The pastries all look good but because of their hours I never get to try them. Bakeries should be open early and all weekend. This place is right next to my house and I go out every weekend for coffee and something sweet. I'd like to do more than peek in the windows at this place.

Unfortunately since Rolling Dough bought the bakery,  the products and experience have declined drastically. The place was dirty, the employees were blah, and the pastries were dry. So sad since it used to be a wonderful place to have lunch or a treat.

Love this hidden gem! Been a few times for coffee/ tea and a light late lunch. Food is always delicious and homemade. The croissants are super good, really big, buttery and flaky. The soup du jour was chicken noodle, very cozy with a hint of lemon and the perfect foil for a cool windy day. It's a bright, quiet and clean cafe with the added bonus of intoxicating aromas of freshly baked goodies. 

The staff are phenomenal! Very sweet and attentive.

The pictures look good doesn't it? Well, that's what brought me in. I walked in already knowing what I wanted cause I went through every picture posted.  The banana cream was just ok. It literally had 1 piece of chopped up banana inside. There wasn't much cream filling. The rest was a whole bunch of whip cream.  The cream filling wasn't that sweet so another star for that.

The red velvet cake was dry.  I had better.  I was expecting a moist Slice of cake but in return it was very dry.

The tiramisu was just ok.  It was a little soggy and water was dripping or if the container.  It didn't have any creamy consistency of a tiramisu.  


Why did I give it 4 stars when almost everything I tasted was 2 stars tasting? The gals that work there was nice.  The place is very clean. It's well decorated and has a welcoming feeling.

I read about this place and was excited to try it. I purchased a banana cream tart (individual) and a whole Red Velvet cake (6 or 7 inches tops).  Here are my thoughts. 

The banana tart was amazing. Truly an elevated product involving pastry and confection. The crust was a perfect puff pastry, the filling sublime, real whipped cream (in a nice pattern like little balloons), topped with a few drzzles of caramel and white/milk striped chocolate curls.  You can't even compare it with anything else in town. I think it was $5 and was worth every penny if not more. 

I have to admit I had specific ideas about the Red Velvet cake (for a variety of personal and culinary reasons). The cake did hit 2 very important marks.  First, the cake itself had some chocolate flavor notes (I think a proper Red Velvet cake is a derivative of a devils food cake).  Second, I was wondering what they would do with the standard frosting (which is heavy with cream cheese and cloyingly sweet). I am pleased to write, the cake was perfect and the cream cheese icing was light and smooth (like a mouseline).  I think that little cake was $45.  On one hand, that's pretty damn expensive for such a tiny cake  On the other hand, there is no comparable bakery in town (that I know of). 

Everyone I know orders cakes from Freed's. They are pretty cakes, but I don't really think their product is much better than a grocery store cake.  

Since i just criticized Freed's, I guess I should admit that I don't care for fondant and when I make buttercream I start with a sugar syrup  I I don't think Freed's does and I believe C&S does.  Contrary to popular belief, a real buttercream is not just a muxture of confectioners sugar, butter (or worse, Crisco) and extract. 

Everyone deserves some decadent pasty once in a while. 

Reward yourself (or a foodie you know) with the taste of excellence at Chocolate & Spice.

We're a small company coming from out-of-town that needed some on-site catering needs at a local convention.  After reviewing multiple Yelp reviews, I settled on Chocolate and Spice as I loved the elegance and detail that Megan put in all her previous work.  Despite being a new establishment, Megan is by no means new to the high-end pastry world.  Let me tell you, she is perhaps one of the best pastry chefs I've ever met or had the pleasure of working with.  Having lived in New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Boston, and all across Asia, I have never met someone that could produce such deliciously consistent, yet beautiful desserts.  Her French Macaroons are just as good as Bouchon, her shortbread espresso cookies are to die for, and her pistachio biscotti are amazing.  She may not produce a huge variety, but I'd rather have incredible quality as there are many other dessert shops out there that have tons of variety but mediocre quality.  

Given her work experience and tenure at some of Las Vegas' top hotels, I emailed her a quick picture of what I was thinking of and she came with her staff to do a full setup.  We had people comment all day on how great everything looked.  We were giving out 5 different small dessert varieties and each one was carefully packaged and delivered.  I can't tell you what a professional she was.  She even took care to weigh and measure her desserts given the restrictions we were working with at the Hotel Convention Center.  I would highly recommend her for any wedding or catering job as you're not going to find someone better in Vegas area - she's as good as it gets!

I love this place! Friendly service, delicious food, welcoming atmosphere... it has it all! I stop by every time I come into town from L.A. Their nutella lattes are TDF and go perfectly with their fresh, warm and buttery croissants! Ugh, so good! Also, everything is so beautifully presented and everyone is so nice!

This is also a must try place! I live so close to it so for a little breakfast and some coffee it's a great place to go. They have creme brûlée French toast that is to die for!! All of their cakes and pastries that I've tried are absolutely phenomenal! The pistachio cake is my favorite :)

This is my first time here. Walking in with Frank Sinatra on the speakers I had high hopes. Great design and atmosphere. Sophisticated yet inviting with a relax feel. 
The food is a bit pricey but worth it from time to time for a nice lunch and change from the daily fast food runs and over crowded restaurants.  I would recommend this place for sure and they can count on me coming back to try the bacon Mac n cheese.
I cannot say enough good things about this place.   Good ambiance.   Great food and customer service.    Highly suggested if u haven't been.

I was aware of the bakery but didn't realize they had a cafe! Ordered the portobello sandwich with a side of potato salad and a Cobb salad with blue cheese. Both were very yummy! I was pleasantly surprise by the sandwich. Very flavorful, the balsamic was just the right amount. On top of the two previously mentioned entrees, we ordered the mac & three cheeses and picked two pastries all for under $40. I will definitely go back and prefer to go here versus another restaurant up the street who are known for their pies. Only thing is this place has a limited selection of food and a great selection of pastries. Loved the decor of the restaurant and the people are very friendly.

I'm in bakery heaven!  There is so much to choose from and it all looks delicious.  I have already been twice and can see it would not be hard for me to become a regular here.  The interior decoration is very inviting and service is great.  They get bonus points for serving such delicious espresso drinks!
I had their soup and half sandwich combo on my last visit - ham and cheese on focaccia with gazpacho, and it is apparent that quality ingredients are a priority here.  I loved the individual banana cream pie I had for dessert, the interior was light and creamy and the crust was flaky.  I got to try a bite of the strawberry napoleon, and would have been just as pleased with that selection.  
I am excited to see businesses like this spread out across Vegas and will be sure to do my part to support them.
Best Bakery!! S'more was delicious and the staff was so sweet and nice!!

My Bf bought me a bunch of desserts from this bakery for my birthday, and each of them were unique & delicious.. and cute! The designs of these sweets were enough to make me drool. I decided I had to check this place out in person, so we went for brunch. He ordered the french toast & I ordered a veggie panini with chicken & a cup of tomato soup.. everything was delicious! The young asian lady working at the counter was also very polite & helpful to customers. This is a great place to spend your time in the morning to read the news or catch up on emails, etc. Very pleasant atmosphere :)

Super cute place!  Amazing staff, our waitress was friendly and polite.  Grilled Cheese was fantastic!  Fresh bread fresh cheeses and very cheeses.  Then the desserts to go....Sunday Funday - Perfect / Oreo Mousse - light and right amount of sweet / Croissant - light and fluffy with a perfect crunchy crush / Very Berry mini Pie -  Crumbles are to die for!

My husbands co-worker has been raving about this place for months.  My husband threw me a surprise birthday party and purchased a german chocolate cake with a dulce de leche topping.  It was amazing and a hit at the party.  In fact one of the guest ordered the same cake a week later for her daughters birthday.  

Recently, we have gone back to eat breakfast.  My husband loves the croissant sandwich.  I had the creme brulee french toast which was good, but if you don't like raisins then it may not be for you.  This last time I had the turkey sausage and egg muffin sandwich.  It too was great.  We have tried a few of the cupcakes, creme brulee, and the nutella bomb and all were amazing.  

I don't think you can go wrong eating here.

Tried banana cream pie ($3.75), pistachio ice cream ($3.50/cup) vegetable frittata ($4.75) and chocolate hazelnut brownie bombe ($3.75)
Honestly, I don't think this place deserves 5 stars. The desserts are good looking but nothing fancy. The young girl who served us was friendly. From all the reviews here, I thought one bite and I would be in dessert heaven, but..... Both my husband and I were disappointed. We both went hungry too. I noticed there were 2 reviews here that were composed by someone with no friends and only had one review? Hmmm.....

I can't believe that this great little spot is in Vegas!
Wonderful, warm, cozy spot for breakfast, lunch or sweet snacking.  Great sandwiches, pastries and chocolates. Everything is fresh and beautifully displayed.  Come support this restaurant so it will be around for a long time.
The bakery is beautiful.  Filled with delicious pastries.  They serve sandwiches too.  A must stop while in Vegas!!!

Had a birthday party to go to and decided to swing by last minute and get some treats - I was super impressed with this hidden gem!  

Such a beautiful store and they had lots of choices of elegantly decorated mini desserts as well as other cakes and tarts.  I decided on 8 different mini's and they were wrapped up and put into a gorgeous box.

Everything was a huge hit!

Short review: go, eat, eat a lot. You're getting world-class quality pastry at neighborhood prices.

I ordered a half-sandwich and a banana cream pie. The sandwich started sort of non-descript, but the more I got into the cranberry bread and the light mayo/dressing, the more I liked it. A half ($5.50) is plenty if you plan to eat dessert. Oh, by the way: plan to eat dessert.

I worked at Mandalay while Chef Romano was at Aureole and had the privilege of enjoying her work multiple times, so I came in knowing what to expect. The cream in the little flaky pie shell was fantastic, light and rich at the same time. The caramel was unreal, a total standout. I paid $4. If you're wondering if that's good or bad, just know you could easily pay $10 for the same dessert if Chef Romano were making it inside a casino.

Yeah, I know $2-3 for a croissant or bun seems like a little extra. For the quality, it's worth the money. Go enjoy something of a quality you don't often get to enjoy at a fair price and without walking through a smoky row of slot machines to get to it.

Unfortunately, they changed the Nutella bombs. Not a good move. On top of that, they gave us the wrong ones and we got some banana bomb that was not good.  Was the place sold to a different bakery? Not happy.

I love this place, their amazing dishes, their employees and their interior design! I have had their Egg White Frittata! (I hope I spelled that dish right :-) ) and I can't remember how many times but I never get tired of it. it taste so clean and a great dish to start my day with. They also have some sweets you just can't wait to take to a party. My first time there was a great experience and was followed by many more great ones. 

I'd say maybe it can be a little hard to find at first but it is right on southeast corner of Teneya and Sahara blvd. It is definitely worth going once as you'll probably go back again and again, I know I have.

The customer service here is really bad.  I've been here about a dozen times and I'd say 8 or 9 of the times I'm standing at the counter for an extended period of time waiting for one of the employees to arrive to assist me.  After it happened again today I have to say goodbye to this place.

Too bad, the food is above average, although realistically too pricey for what you get.
Nothing is labeled so you'll have to ask an employee (once they arrive) what is what.

This place is in dire need of a manager who understands customer service.  Or maybe they just need a bell on the door.
This place is adorable, different and yummy. The price is not bad and the service has been great. You gotta check them out. The cakes are amazing looking and creative.

First time trying this place , Our waitress was very sweet but, was not very attentive. I got the 3 grilled cheese with tomato soup and i was not impressed. The soup was very little in quantity and the flavor was just okay. The grilled cheese was overly cheesy and the cheese tasted like sliced kraft cheese yuck ! My girlfriend got a burger and it was over salted. Then i got a raspberry lemon bunt cake and salted caramel bunt cake. Both of the cakes were very dry. The raspberry lemon one had good flavor but, the salted caramel one tasted like plain caramel nothing special. Will not be returning here again.
Did my wedding cake here, tried coffee and cupcakes...Very good! Nice coffee house feel when you enter! Clean as well! Staff looks helpful and a desire to treat you nicely...Prices seem moderate...
Very trendy and cool place to eat. Waiter was a little dense about pretty much everything but the food and coffee was good. Not your typical place for breakfast.

The food here is amazing.  Awesome service very friendly.  
The Ham and Brie sandwich is great. I would definitely recommend this little place to all of my friends.

Checking in through Yelp gives you a widdle fruit tart. I'll post a photo. The crust was buttery but firm and the filling was pudding consistency and delightful, especially when eaten with the topped raspberries. 

I ordered the egg white frittata which is simply egg whites, Parmesan, spinach, and cherry tomatoes. My order came with a beautiful display of fresh fruit though the menu does offer options of a potato salad, mixed green salad, or fruit. 

The frittata was probably really good for what it was but it wasn't filled with flavor and the size made me pout a little (a bit bigger than the size of my palm). I loved that the side of fruit wasn't mixed together, keeping the flavors distinct. 

I did see some large sandwiches being served so you can get full here. 

I also heard a customer request the french toast 2 hrs after breakfast stopped being served and they happily accommodated. 

I ordered a hazelnut latte ($3.75) and I loved it for the price. I'm a sucker for good foam and even though this one didn't have it, I still liked the latte. 

There is ample seating here with 5 4-tops, a 6-8top and bar-style high top table/seating. Boarding the windows are tiger striped, comfy, high backed recliner like chairs that really add flare the the place. 

There was a lot of business types around having lunch. The lady tending the register was also the "server" and she was very pleasant and attentive.

I absolutely love this place. What I love even more is that it is down the street from my work so I can grab lunch here once a week! My go-to order is the lunch special half veggie panini and tomato soup. The tomato soup is fairly thin, but the best tasting tomato soup I have ever had. It is not creamy or thick, but you can tell it is made fresh--I love it! The veggie panini is delish and comes with pesto which is to die for. I always ask for no butter or oil on the panini since it was super buttery the first time I got it (it was good, not going to lie but I don't need the extra calories!!)

Megan Romano, the former executive pastry chef of Aureole in mandalay bay has opened her bakery/confectionary shop called Chocolate and Spice. This place is fantastic. A beautiful cafe that is well designed, she offers breakfast pastries, desserts, ice creams, candy confections, as well as some savory items and coffee. I tried her chocolate caramel tart, brioche, and mille-feille. 

Chocolate Tart - When I put my spoon into it, the first thought that came to mind was "uh oh, my teeth are going to hurt.." Usually chocolate desserts that are this dense and heavy are overly sweet. But this shows Megan's brilliance. After I put it in my mouth, it was perfectly balanced and not too sweet! I was delightfully surprised.

Brioche, - Soft buttery brioche. It was mixed correctly and baked correctly. Well done.

Mille Feuille - Flaky mille feille with a sweetened cream and fruits, very good.

If your a fan of great bakeries, you gotta check this place out!!

Clean.

Friendly.

Nice.

Oh, and the pastries ... oh, the pastries...  Holy Sh*t, the pastries!  Wow! 

Had french toast, soup and a panini here ... was nothing amazing, but - THE PASTRIES!

Wow factor as soon as you walk in.

Also, very good coffee!

Worth checking out.
Great experience. The staff was very attentive and made every effort to ensure I was having a pleasant dining experience. The food and coffee were tasty too!

Been here twice now. A couple of friends love this place, and rave about it constantly, but I haven't been bowled over. Both times I went, they were out of anything I wanted, the service wasn't great (despite being almost empty), and I had to ask about each item in the case, since there weren't any signs telling me what they were. 

Had the spice cake...Nice flavor, but was a bit stale.
Chocolate cake, same.
Salad, ok. It's a mixed greens bag salad with bought salad dressing. Can't mess that up too badly. 
Pasta -- my friend loved hers, I thought mine would have been better had it been hot and not lukewarm. 

Everything is beautifully presented, I just think I haven't had any great experiences here.

I stopped in the day before Thanksgiving for pies.  Having not been in previously or given thought to pre ordering, there wasn't a huge selection.  I wanted pumpkin pie and they had one left.  Scored!  I was somewhat taken aback at the price of this one little pie, but I went with it.  Best.pie.ever.  My palate is not easy to please.  I know good taste when it's in my mouth.  Magical. Worth every cent.

Food was exceptional! The prices were fair for the quality of food received. However, I felt for the lovely server who was buy herself doing everything for everyone. You are the bomb girl and shame on the store for under staffing!

I am totally disappointed. Went to this place, based off the reviews & I was SO excited. I couldn't wait to get my hands on their loved banana creme pie. Got there, they didn't have any. So I asked for a slice of chocolate cake (w/ Nutella mousse) & a brownie parfait. 

Sorry to say, I am not impressed. What. So. Ever. The chocolate cake is dry. Tastes like it had been sitting out for a few days. The brownie parfait isn't anything to rave about either. 

Might I just add - if you have a popular item, it would be a good idea if you had some to sell, especially on the weekend.

The last time I was here was in 2014 and I loooooooved everything! From the pastries, to the customer service, the staff. 

BUT NOW?! What the hell happened!!! I was greeted by the chef who was writing on the counter top. I asked him about a few cakes and he seems to be UNSURE of what it is or what it's made of. So I said I'm just gonna wait for the lady who's serving another customer. But he insisted on helping me so I ordered cake slices from him. I had to repeat the question 3 FCKING TIMES just so he could get what I was asking which is simply, WHAT IS INSIDE OF THAT CAKE? 

Another thing, I saw these ladies preparing a made to order. Apparently, they were for the casinos. So I asked if a normal person like me could also order those and OH MY GOD. IT'S LIKE THEY DONT KNOW HOW TO ANSWER MY QUESTION!

I ordered a slice of cake and guess what, the chef just put it in the box just like that! No paper underneath, no foil, no nothing! It's like putting a slice of cake on the floor! COMMON SENSE MAN!!! (I posted a picture of it so y'all can see!)

Seems like you hired the wrong people! Plus the wrong move of combining 2 names of "ROLLING IN DOUGH BAKERY" & "CHOCOLATE & SPICE". The first name is TERRIBLE. BAD BUSINESS AHEAD OF YOU. PAGING CHEF MEGAN! Where are you now?!

New ownership prompted a revisit to Rolling in Dough, now marketed as a cafe rather than a bakery! The lunch specials seem to be their forte these days, with a decadent burger and a warming grilled cheese-tomato bisque combo. 

They still have a case full of baked goods and most are done fairly well but I'd stick to the dessert items over pastries such as croissants and danishes that have seemed less than fresh on a couple of visits. I've also been underwhelmed by lattes here- staff have seemed confused about how to make their specialty drinks, so that's an area to improve upon. Stick to actual food items here for best experience. 

Exterior signage states that they now offer a wine bar menu- may revisit to check that out with friends, but for now I'll stick to lunches. Next on my list is the BLT with pimiento cheese!

Just had lunch and im pretty disappointed with this dinning experience :(

Had to wait long, there were only two other customers dinning at this time. 

Ordered:
-Grilled cheese with tomato soup: grilled cheese was good but the tomato soup had a consistency of puréd tomatoes, was not very fond of it.
-Macaroni & cheese: excellent, simple.
-Portobello mushroom sandwich: had too much balsamic vinegar. 

After we ordered my niece pointed out that some of our meals should come with a side which they failed to ask what sides we wanted for our meal had to remind them.  Ordered fresh fruit for one of them, never made it out until my 8 year old niece made a reminder. 

Checked in on Yelp and asked them about the 1 free-tart offer, had to remind them AGAIN.

Ordered a hazelnut almond milk ice coffee to-go. It was made wrong the first time..there was no almond milk at all, tasted like a cold brew. 
Made it a second time. Still was not right but i had already spent a longer time than I intended being there and i was not willing to wait any longer to get it correct. 

When i received my drink.. i tasted it, wasn't right. tried getting the waitresses attention to inform her, but when i look she was at the register on her phone! Did not even try to hide it. Pet peeve. So instead i had to walk up to the register to deliver my concern. Wow. 

It just feels like service is not very consistent, poor performance, kept having to remind the waitress. Never came to get the check when we paid for our meal, had to go up to the register. It was just a awful experience all in all. 

I believe my last review was all because of the great service Robin provided. She was on top of her game, this is just an unfortunate experience i wish didn't happen.
1st time being there it was such a pleasure the food was actually really good and so was the coffee the people were so friendly and it was a great location I am deathly can I go back there

I was at Rolling in Dough Cafe today for lunch and I have NEVER been so disappointed with the level of poor customer service!!! I understand there's a lunch time rush and I am perfectly fine with waiting for my turn, but I will not tolerate being treated as if I'm invisible. I came into the restaurant, took a seat and waited for the server because she said she would take my order at the table. I waited for at least 5-10 minutes and she didn't come by my table so I decided to walk over to the counter and place my order there so that I wouldn't have to keep waiting for the server to come to me. When I got up to the counter another customer who just walked in happened to line up ahead of me. The server and I made eye contact but despite this she took the late arrival customer and her friend's order before taking mine. I felt very dismissed by this server because she should have told the other customers that I've been here longer and she should take my order first. I don't typically pull out the race card but I couldn't help but to notice I was the only non-Caucasian customer in the restaurant at the time........ I think the food at this restaurant is good, but the customer service stinks so much that I will NEVER visit again!!!

As crazy as it sounds, after eating next door at the sushi place, we end up here for a slice of carrot cake despite being already full from sushi. It's a wonderful coffee and pastry place for a family or just yourself. 

My favorite is the Vanilla latte and it's much tastier than the commercial coffee shops.
They have wonderful service, the manager Robin, and Mikael are always so bubbly and kind. 

A good place to chill and kickback!

The service here is incredible! You're given a warm welcome right upon walking in. Not only will you feel catered for, but you'll also be having some yummy food! 

My mom and I ordered the breakfast sandwiches, hers with ham and pepper jack while mine was with spinach and pepper jack. Both come with an egg as well. Mine wasn't runny at all as the menu had described it to be. I recommend trying the hazelnut latte if you like sweet coffee, but they also offer sugar-free version as well. Our server made sure everything was perfect for us, making the experience much more homey. 

The way they've designed the cafe is really adorable too. There are seats on the side that are super comfortable if you're planning on reading a book or getting some homework done. Overall, it's a very cute place for brunch!
The food is fantastic. The pastries are to die for.  Their specialty coffees are delicious.  Will go back without hesitation.  I highly recommend this cafe. Very good service.

Visit here for a decent pastry, but prepare thyselves for an exercise in patience and miscommunication on simple matters. It shouldn't be rocket science, but rocket science is what you will be dabbling in at Chocolate & Spice (now Rolling in Dough, what a name). Walking in here is like walking into a barn and watching all the mice scurry away. A customer! Panic! 

Service here is excruciating. This being my third visit, it's safe to say that confused-and-bumbling service is the norm. Quite unfortunate--and quite odd--for the interior presentation leads one to believe that this joint has its act together. The design is cute, the seating comfortable and plenty, music is at an appreciable level, the menu for food is short yet diverse, and the pastries are easy on the eyes. 

I have never had an unpleasant item here; everything has been quite tasty.

But man, the service kills it. Never to return. Today, for example, I ordered the breakfast croissant sandwich with omelet. I was met with a confused look, and asked, "what would you like on that?" I returned the confused look with one of my own and said, "what do you mean? I want exactly what's listed on the menu, it's item #4, so the ham, the cheese, the omelet, etc." The waitstaffer turned to look at the menu for a moment, a long pause, until she turned back and asked, "so on a croissant? This is a croissant," and she points to one under a glass case. 

Yes, I am AWARE of what a croissant is, thank you.

This is not the first time I've met someone in Chocolate  & Spice who appears utterly confused by their own menu. I looked at that menu for one minute and had it figured out and mostly memorized. This isn't a matter of "we just hired this person," it's a matter of what seems to be a systemic issue with the types of people they hire to take orders. They are confused, frantic, inattentive, and preoccupied with whatever other tasks they think they should be doing aside from giving the two customers they have in there their undivided attention.

It makes for an often uncomfortable and (to put it mildly) frustrating customer experience. 

My first visit? There was one person working and no one else in the joint. Just me, and her. She's racing around, chatting on a phone, and tells me to just shout her way when I'm ready. No opportunity for pleasantries or to ask questions, SHE'S JUST SO BUSY! 

Back for seconds--only because my edible espresso mousse cup was so good--I have another lackluster exchange with staff. They just seem so disjointed, like it's a challenge or a pain to work in what should be a delightful and quaint Vegas cafe and bakery.

This third time, though? Between the confusion on my simple order, the weird carnival smile I was given with my coffee (what did you put in there??), and the major cashier fiasco for the friend I decided to introduce to this place, I can't take it any more. Is their litmus test for new staff just complete ineptitude and social awkwardness? 

High marks for the dude chef who made my croissant sandwich. It was excellent, sir.
High marks for the behind-the-scenes pastry crew, you do fine FINE work.

But damn, get the front of the house in order, it's just sad.

Very cute little bakery...

Walking in, I couldn't help but feel it was very quaint, had a definite feminine touch to it. No offense, but I could pictures the ladies lounging, drinking coffee, nibbling on a pastry, and enjoying the ambiance. 

After reading the reviews, I decided to make a stop Tuesday morning (Closed Mondays). I ordered the Roast Vegetable Egg White Frittata and the popular mini Banana Cream Pie. Their pastries definitely look top notch, so edible and pretty. I was disappointed that they couldn't serve a nutella latte that morning, so I opted for a hazelnut one instead. 

I loved their banana cream pie. And I don't usually eat banana cream. The frittata was A-OK. Latte was very tasty and well-made.

They definitely have many selections to drool over, so I'll have to make another trip here. I think their scones were calling my name.
Awesome bakery with the friendliest staff. I am amazed at the dessert collection! We are from Oceanside and saw this bakery as we were driving past it. Boy did we luck out.

The name itself had me curious, I mean anything puny, I'm in ! 
The place has a split setting, dining and ordering to be in/out. Went in for brunch and ordered the breakfast burger which was a good portion and tasted amazing. Only complaint were the hash browns. Sort of strong on the garlic and pepper....but I guess that's just preference.

**check-in! You'll get a free mini tart and it was perfect :) 

The service overall was friendly and the place was clean. If I lived closer, maybe I'd stop in again, but nothing on the menu had me curious for more. 

Definitely glad I tried it. 10/10 would be back IF they sold creme brûlée....

OMG where have I been?? I came out for some fresh air and breakfast. I didn't want a large branded restaurant, I wanted local love. 
The place is adorable. The decor is quaint and inviting. The selection of pastries was perfect. 
I ordered the 2 eggs and bacon (keeping it simple).
The plate was nice; how else do you present 2 eggs sunny side up, two slices of bacon, hash browns, Carmel macchiato, and buttery croissant. 
In my idiotic brain, I asked for ketchup, strawberry jelly, and butter. Before I added anything I decided to taste first. Good Lord it was AMAZEBALLZ! Even the hash browns did not need any help! The croissant was so buttery and flaky I almost cried. I used it to dip in the yolk -NO CONDIMENTS WERE NEEDED!! Everything was made with love and care. Thank you chicken, pig, potatoes, cow, coffee Gods, and Rollin in Dough.
#regular #amazeballs #illbeback
Had the Rueben today. It was amazing. Haven't had one this good since New York. People are very friendly and helpful here.

Best place in the west side for sweets! If you are looking for best cakes... look no more, you can find it here! Try the blackout (for the chocolate lovers) and the berries cheesecake are simply to die for. Service is friendly and the place is neat and clean. Good music... should I really continue? Just come down and fall in love with this place!

You walk in and immediately love the vibe! It's light, airy and comforting... The coffee is amazing, the pastries are beautifully delightful and it's a great spot for a light lunch! I had the smashed avocado sandwich, tomato drizzled in balsamic topped with a hard egg. It was delish! A great place to meet a friend for coffee or wine

Went there once before because of the hype and wasn't impressed with either the service or the food but I saw in a local magazine that they have pumpkin swirl brownies right now. So I thought I'd give it another try. I check Yelp, their website (which gives neither address nor hours at least on mobile) and their Facebook. Everything says open until 6PM. So I make a special trip out from Henderson and get there three minutes to four and the door is locked. On the door is a faded home printer print out that says nope, closes at 4PM now.  

Well, this was the second chance shot and they blew it.  So I went down the street to La Belle Terre just down the street, who was open. And they got my money.

Came in for lunch today. Super cute cafe, the tables and chairs don't all look the same, but they go together well. The staff was friendly and fretted me as I walked in the door. I was slightly confused on how it worked, if I sat down myself or ordered at the counter. Their display case is beautiful!!!  The treats and goodies are clearly displayed and look amazing. I had the grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup for lunch, my goodness it was delicious!! Cheesy, melty, ans the bread was perfectly crunchy. I got a goodie to go home and they boxed it up for me and brought it to my table. I will definitely be back!
Best cake ever!  I've loved everything I've ordered here from the food, cakes, cookies, and drinks!  This is a place I always take my family and friends when they visit.  It's a real treat!

I read about this place in a Sunset Magazine article detailing all of the great things happening in Vegas that don't involve large corporations and gambling. This place is out of the way, making it a locals' spot, but I'm sorry to say it wasn't worth the drive. 

The focus is desserts and a few savory lunch items, all of which looked and sounded delicious. However, after trying two items, I left disappointed. Especially since the establishment is owned by a lauded Las Vegas pastry chef who left well known casino restaurant to start Chocolate & Spice. That said, I really wanted to love the place, but I just couldn't. 

Being a lover of Nutella, I gravitated towards the Nutella latte and a Nutella bomb cake. The latte was weak on espresso and Nutella flavor and the cake didn't taste like it contained any Nutella. 

Maybe I just tried the wrong things, but given the distance traveled and the Sunset Magazine and yelp reviews, Chocolate & Spice did not meet my expectations.

Everything was amazing! What was more amazing was how we squeaked in 15 minutes prior to close while they were shutting down the kitchen. They fired up the energy to deliver a great meal of Mac and Cheese, Bucatini Pasta and yummy cakes and chocolate.

This rivals any Named Bakery or cafe on the strip, minus the inflated price and annoying parking roulette.

GO, GO, GO! Lets keep the small guy in business!

If you have not visited Rolling in Dough, do it now! If you are a bride, email them TODAY! 

It was a pleasure working with Pam and her team. I brought 4 of my bridesmaids/friends to my tasting, and Pam made it the most incredible hour! They even had my favorite champagne for us when we sat down, it doesn't get much better than desserts and champagne. Pam makes the most incredible desserts, and prior to my experience with her (at the age of 23) I didn't like cake at all. Well not anymore! I like her cakes! Not sure about others, though lol. We enjoyed spending time with her, and the dessert bar we designed was delicious! Our cake was a three tier, three different flavor beauty! We loved it, thank you Pam and team!

We loooooooved this place! We ordered a ton of stuff the spinach quiche, mini vanilla and Nutella donuts, breakfast croissant sandwich and the ice coffees which were excellent!!! Great service from the girl helping us this morning. I was craving a muffin and we found this place, although they didn't have muffins the quiche and mini donuts were very very good!

After having lunch with a friend, the sign for this place caught our eyes so we decided to stop by and take a look. The place is very spacious, decorated very modern and chic, nice and clean. Staff was very nice and friendly, my friend spilled her drink and the waitress cleaned our table without any annoyance for attitude, we really appreciate that!!

We decided to get some coffee and ordered the caramel vanilla latte, this was very good. Just sweet enough, not too sweet to where you can't finish the drink. The latte had a pretty little snowflake on top!

They have a variety of teas and and coffees, breakfast and lunch menus, definitely plan on coming back to try their food.

Reminded me of Panera, but a step above. The decor was nice and the staff were friendly, but not very helpful. I had informed the lady behind the counter that it was my first time expecting she would maybe give suggestions...nope. So going with my gut instincts (and a little help from the yelp community) I ordered the butternut squash soup and chicken salad wrap...DELISH!!! My friends ordered the tomato soup, which was only "okay." Not thick enough was the complaint. 

The environment was comfortable allowing us to sit and chat for awhile. We did move over to the more comfy chairs, but quickly learned to be careful not to lean your arms onto the metal accents on the arm chair...ouch! 

I would definitely try this place again if on that side of town, but I live in Henderson and don't see myself driving across town for this place. Good, but not amazing.

The best local bakery and cafe! Comparable to Jean Philippe. Everything is made gourmet quality, and refined. The place is very cute too, very comfortable to sit and enjoy brunch or a coffee. The scones are the best I have ever had!!! Soups and sandwiches are great, I love love love their chicken salad on a croissant. Definitely have to try this place if you like places like Bouchon and you won't be disappointed!
The place looks amazing and the food I've seen come out is tantalizing. Can't wait for my food.
Service is awesome vibe is hip, food delicious! definitely coming back. Recommend to all!
Been here twice...the food is excellent. Service is excellent. Great coffee. Price is a little high, but the food is worth it. Has a cozy atmosphere. A 5 star in a slowly degrading Vegas.
Excellent omelets and coffee. Very nice decor and ambience. Very polite staff, excellent service. Highly recommended.
Looking for the perfect birthday brunch for my daughters birthday... This place was perfect! Great environment, exceptional service, and delicious food!!

Service - After seeing the great reviews on yelp, I was excited to try it when in the neighborhood. The 1st time, it was closed with a note on the door. Fine. It happens. The 2nd time the doors are locked even though the sign says it opens at 10 & it is 10:15. Ok. Maybe something happened.  Then employee R. comes to inform me this is my mistake, they don't open until 10. I tell her it's after,  &she assumes I mean it is after they're usual early start time & begins to tell me how it's labor day weekend & the hours are changed. As if I am clueless. I tell her it is 15min after 10. She then goes to check. Why would anyone not check the time before telling a customer they are wrong & must wait.

This has to be the CUTEST place ever! I wouldn't hesitate at all to bring my friends here for a great treat and a good talk! It was just a girl's bakery fantasy! 

So, a definite 5 stars for the ambience and deco. Now to the food. We got the banana cream pie (great presentation), Tiramisu, & S'mores Bar. 

To be honest, none of these desserts blew me away, but they were definitely unique and tasty. The banana cream pie was great. The puff pastry was lined with white chocolate on the inside and was delicious! The s'mores bar is good if you like peanut butter...(which I don't). I didn't enjoy the tiramisu much. It just didn't have that deep flavor I'm used to in my favorite tiramisus.

It's definitely a place worth checking out ASAP!

The wife and I just stopped into this chocolate and spice bakery to grab some coffee. What a wonderful atmosphere! It's so cute in here. We really love it. The fruit tart is delicious. The Americano coffee that we had was amazing! We will definitely be back.

I've been here 3 times in the past 4 days.  Why have I not visited earlier?  C&S is adorable and cosy and charming, offering sweet sophistication to those of us on the westside.  I've sampled a lemon tart, red velvet cake, chocolate biscotti, lemon-scented vanilla cake, apple pie, raspberry pie, banana cream tart, and blueberry scone.  (N.B.  My exercise level has increased dramatically this past week!)  All were fantastic and fresh and fruity and yummy.  The icings on the cake aren't too sweet and the pastry is flaky and light.  My turkey sandwich last night was savoury and sweet at the same time!  That apricot jam complements the turkey and cheese nicely.  If you don't want pastries or "real food," there is always the gelato case with 8 different flavours of dairy decadence or the chocolate/bonbon case with its array of temptations.  

Service has always been with a smile.  :)  Just GO if you haven't already!

We originally came here for desserts and coffee, but quickly realized that they also serve prepared, savory foods. We chose to share an order of the Lobster Bisque and the Blackforest Ham & Cheese Panini. I've had really good Lobster Bisque before, and I hope this does not disappoint... And it definitely did not disappoint! The bisque was creamy and flavorful, but the best part is that there a several good sized CHUNKS of lobster pieces in the bowl of soup! The panini was also very good, especially with the dollop of pesto sauce to lightly dip each bite of the sandwich with. 
Beautiful Desserts: there were so many items to choose from, and all the dessert items were beautifully decorated. Between the three of us, we shared 4 dessert items. As I was too full from the bisque and panini, the most memorable item I sampled was the Banana Creme Pie. As we were leaving, I looked at the tiramisu cake in its display and considered ordering it to go, but I think I'll save that for next time!
Charming environment: There are some tables and chairs to accommodate a small group, yet cozy enough for a couple on a date. I could definitely picture a small group gathering here for a bridal/baby shower. I will definitely return here for a light lunch with friends one day.

This bakery has some great treats.  Delectable macarons stuffed with raspberries and whipped cream.  The strawberry rhubarb pie was excellent.  And my latest discovery - banana french toast with granola - superb.  Everything here has been great.  Items do change regularly so your favorites may not be there at all times.  But everything has been excellent.  Branch out and try something new.  You won't be disappointed.

Aureole's loss is Vegas's gain, as Megan Romano's new off-Strip bakery cafe is simply perfect. If you are in the mood for a breakfast pastry, ice cream, fancy chocolate confection, exquisite dessert creation, or even an artisan loaf of bread, Chocolate & Spice will make your decision that much more complicated, because everything is delicious. I suggest visiting with a group and ordering a great variety to share (or fight over.) Stop in for breakfast, lunch, or an early dessert, as they close at 7pm.

Today was the grand opening, and I stared at the many options in the display case for a long while before ordering an iced coffee and a honey brioche sticky bun to enjoy in the store. To take home, I also selected a blueberry financier (I don't know how to say "no" to a financier) and a strawberry lemon napoleon with layers of puff pastry, lemon cake, strawberry jam, and lemon cream. Savory selections included fritattas, quiche, sandwiches, salads, and pastas. While I placed my order, a freezer case was being stocked with freshly made ice creams and sorbets. Additional shelves held bags of candy and caramel nut popcorn with dried cranberries and golden raisins. Before leaving, several baskets of bread behind the counter caught my eye, and I picked up a baguette to take home. This bread, along with everything else I tried, tastes and looks like it belongs on a table in a fancy restaurant. (Some of the bread is brought in from Vegas's own Bon Breads, so it is also served in many high end restaurants.)

One of my favorite spots in Vegas. Every single time I come, they bring out my food fast! I always get the French toast, egg white frittata or the breakfast quesadilla. They have some of the best French toast! I literally dream about it! It's that amazing! Lol Their croissants are to die for!! I'm seriously in love with this place. 
I suggest anyone to eat here!! I love it!
Went in at 10 o'clock on Monday to get a quiche and they still weren't made yet. Pretty disappointing

We decided to come here on a Saturday at 330. There website says they close at 6 but when you get here the door says 4. The woman behind the counter wasn't happy we were coming in. I had come in with my kids and wasn't going somewhere else bc we arrived half an hour before close. When we asked what the flavors were she was obviously annoyed and just rambles them off quickly and when we asked her to repeat them she pretended not to hear us. We got the cupcakes to go. They're flavor was above average but the way we were treated ruined this place for me.

I work right across and usually order to go for breakfast &/or lunch.

FAVES:
Breakfast burger
Pumpkin Pie!!
Crispy Chicken Sandwich

We came here last week with high expectations but I think this place is over-hyped. Based on the reviews I was expecting much more. The pastry selection was rather small and several of the desserts were layered puddings which I don't consider to be real desserts (I can make pudding at home). We had the banana muffin which was alright, the banana cream pie was good, and by default we got  a chicken salad sandwich (delicious) because there was nothing else I could find that I wanted to try. They have some good items but for a bakery that is getting 5 star reviews I was expecting a large selection of phenomenal goodies.

Visited here for the first time for morning coffee. I had latte and apple crumble, I asked for cranberry apple crumble but I just had apple crumble. And also I got mini fruit tart when I checked in this place. 
After I read this reviews I was excited and expected everything to be taste great, but everything just okay. I might come back to try lunch here.

O M G. 
Why haven't I been in here sooner? Oh yeah that's right, I never drive by here! Lol
This little gem has an amazing pastry and sweets selection. Taking home 4 different selections for later! 
The staff is all super nice and I love that this place is small and their small staff consists of all different ethnicities. Not the norm I've seen in smaller places, especially bakeries!
The decor is absolutely beautiful, it reminds me of a place in San Diego..
My daughter and I decided to have brunch and I had their bacon and Swiss quiche with tossed salad and it was delectable! 
My daughter had one of their specials, the Burger, hashbrowns and egg sandwich with their fresh fruit. She was asked how she'd like her egg done and ordered it over medium, but it was sunny side up...but she did eat it and enjoyed it.
Overall this place is a must visit! I will definitely be back soon!
OH! And they even have a punch card! Buy 5 meals and get a free dessert! Yasssssssssssss! 
In love 

Ok so I have been here 4 times now and I am sad to say that the dream was short lived....
I went to get food to go and it was so awful! It was undercooked and old ingredients! 
So sad.......

I liked this place-the look, the selection and the service.
We had an awesome maple cake with honey walnut icing and a scone filled with so many big juicy blueberries.
Both for a total of $7.
Going to come back for a breakfast and coffee-their frittata looked amazing!
Clean, quiet & quaint. The champagne & treats were very tasty, and staff very attentive, nice & professional.

Stopped into today after following the hype for the past month or so.
